abstract.text: Saves match data for completed exchanges without ending the turn.

inlineContent.text: Your game-specific data representing the match state including the resolved exchange data.
The completed exchanges that you resolve or merge into the match data.
The block that GameKit calls when it completes the request.
The block receives the following parameter:
Describes an error if it occurs, or
if the operation completes.
error
Use this method to save the exchange data in the match’s
property before the current participant ends their turn, forfeits a match, or ends a match. Alternatively, invoke this method from the
protocol method as recipients reply to individual exchange requests.
This method removes the exchanges from the current participant’s
property and all participant’s
property. So retain your game-specific exchange data and merge it into the match data, before you invoke this method.

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
Handles when all recipients of an exchange request respond.
Exchange request information that participants send in a turn-based match.
An object that encapsulates the match data for games where players take turns.
The exchanges that the local player needs to accept or reject.
The exchange requests that all recipients replied to and the current participant needs to save.
The maximum size of the exchange data.
The maximum number of exchanges the local player can initiate.
The exchange requests that are active or complete.
Saves match data for completed exchanges without ending the turn.
Sends an exchange request that contains your game data to one or more participants.
The amount of time that passes before an exchange times out.
Add the ability for players to exchange game data and send messages while waiting for their turns.

doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/Ga.title: Exchanging data between players in turn-based games

abstract.text: The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
